post_text:
Today, the President declared a National Emergency and the Governor closed all public schools in Pennsylvania for ten (10) business days. All Whitehall-Coplay School District schools will be closed from Monday, March 16, 2020, until and including, Friday, March 27, 2020. Updates will be provided as we work through this issue.
At this time, students are not required to complete any assignments.
Buildings will be accessible on Monday, March 16, 2020, from 9am -12pm for parents that need to pick up medications or other items.
All District events are canceled effective immediately.
Thank you for your cooperation and support.

All District events are canceled effective immediately.
Thank you for your cooperation and support.

post_text: Out of an abundance of caution, the Whitehall-Coplay School District will be canceling all athletic, after school and weekend activities. The Basket Bingo that was scheduled for tomorrow will be rescheduled at a later time. The district will continue to communicate with state and local officials and will update you as new information is received. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

The district will continue to communicate with state and local officials and will update you as new information is received. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

post_text:
The Whitehall Coplay School District was informed that a student in the district was tested for Covid-19 as a precautionary measure. It is important to note that to our knowledge, the student has not traveled or been in contact either directly or indirectly with anyone exposed to Covid-19. We have been in communication with Local and State Health Department officials. For the safety and wellness of our students and staff, the district will be closed for cleaning today, Thursday, March 12th. Friday, March 13th schools will remain closed as this was a regularly scheduled professional development day. Regular classes will resume on Monday, March16th. It is important to reiterate that there are no known or reported cases of Covid-19 in the Whitehall Coplay School District.
We apologize for any inconveniences the late school closure may have caused. Our decisions were made in the best interest of students and staff.

post_text:
A Message from the Superintendent:

I’m contacting you to inform you that the Whitehall Coplay School District will be conducting an Active Violence Drill in conjunction with the Whitehall Township Police Department and Lehigh County Emergency Responders. The drill will take place on Thursday, August 23rd from 8 am until 11:30 am, on the WCSD campus. This is a professional development day for our staff; there will be no students on campus. Once again this will be an Active Violence Drill. During this time period, the School District Campus will be locked down. All entrances to the campus will be closed. As a School District, the safety and security of our Staff and Students is our foremost concern and conducting this drill will enable all involved to practice and prepare for emergency situations. Thank you for your cooperation.

Dr. Lorie Hackett
text:
A Message from the Superintendent:

I’m contacting you to inform you that the Whitehall Coplay School District will be conducting an Active Violence Drill in conjunction with the Whitehall Township Police Department and Lehigh County Emergency Responders. The drill will take place on Thursday, August 23rd from 8 am until 11:30 am, on the WCSD campus. This is a professional development day for our staff; there will be no students on campus. Once again this will be an Active Violence Drill. During this time period, the School District Campus will be locked down. All entrances to the campus will be closed. As a School District, the safety and security of our Staff and Students is our foremost concern and conducting this drill will enable all involved to practice and prepare for emergency situations. Thank you for your cooperation.

Dr. Lorie Hackett

post_text:
Whitehall Night at the Phantoms!

Come join Whitehall High School at the Phantoms home opener on October 10th. Tickets are available at a discounted rate of 16.00 and the Whitehall High School Chorale will be singing the National Anthem.

Ticket sign up is available via a link on the Whitehall High School website and at whitehallchoir.com
text:
Whitehall Night at the Phantoms!

Come join Whitehall High School at the Phantoms home opener on October 10th. Tickets are available at a discounted rate of 16.00 and the Whitehall High School Chorale will be singing the National Anthem.

Ticket sign up is available via a link on the Whitehall High School website and at whitehallchoir.com

Congratulations to all of our graduates!

post_text:
Due to the inclement weather, to date we have been forced to close school a total of of 4 days. We include 3 snow days in the school calendar and any more days beyond 3 must be made up. As was communicated in the district calendar, Friday, February 13, 2015 is listed as a snow make up day.

This correspondence is intended to inform you that schools will now be open and in full session on Friday, February 13, 2015.

Thank you for your cooperation

post_text:
Please take note of the upcoming HOPE (Heroin and Opioid Prevention Education) presentation to be held March 3rd, 6:30 PM at the Whitehall HS LGI Room.

Join other parents and concerned community members to learn more about the heroin and opiate epidemic, including:

- What is Heroin? What are Opioids?
- Signs and Symptoms of Someone Using
- Effects of Use- on Health, Relationships and Life
- Local Resources
- Where to go for Help

HOPE was developed to respond to the growing concern around the heroin and opioid epidemic in Lehigh County and throughout the state of Pennsylvania.

post_text:
Hello everyone!
I just wanted to take a moment to invite you out to the Marching Band's Home Show (which is actually the TOB Eastern PA State Championships this year) on Saturday, October 19th at Zephyr Stadium.
The band is having an outstanding season thus far, and is actually ranked 3rd out of 22 Group 1 Open bands in the entire circuit at the moment!
I know it would mean a lot to the students to have a strong show of support from the home crowd at our show. If you would like to attend, you can purchase tickets in advance or at the gate. Tickets are $10. Just get in touch with me and I can get the tickets to you. The show is scheduled to begin at 6:00 PM.
Thanks for your time and continued support! Hope to see you at the show!

--
Matt Tanzos
Whitehall HS Band Director
7th & 8th Grade Band Director
Zephyr Elementary Percussion Teacher

post_text:
Whitehall's Scholastic Scrimmage team defeated Panther Valley (120-25) today in the first round of the 2013-2014 WLVT-39 Tournament. This match will be aired on November 1st (3:00 p.m.), November 2nd (10:00 a.m.), November 3rd (11:00 a.m.) and November 4th (5:30 p.m.) on PBS Channel 39. Set your DVRs.

The LVIAC season begins on October 21st with a match against Emmaus and Dieruff.

Congrats Whitehall, good luck the rest of the way!

September 25th is McDonald's Night! Come on out and see your teachers and administration. We'll be taking orders and serving from 5-8 p.m. It's a great night and a great fundraiser benefiting our kids directly. We'll be at the McDonald's on MacArthur road next to Taco Bell.

Whitehall High School is proud to announce that student-athletes Kayla Cunningham, Aaron Genevese, Brooke Gilson, Kara Parvel, Cassie Schmidt, Nick Shafnisky, Nick Sommer, James Wah, and Jake Wygant have made official commitments to attend and play college athletics at their respective schools starting in the Fall of 2013.

Congrats to all of these outstanding students. You make us proud!

For a look at the official press release, click the link below.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/18ml6oGmyW_UuFUGsamAtGyuJfhgksSstW1N4JS7gha0/edit?usp=sharing

post_text:
Congratulations to the WHS Cheerleaders on finishing as Runners-up in the District XI Championships this past weekend. They will move on to compete in the PIAA Championships this weekend in Hershey! Congrats to Coach Marsteller, her staff, and team on an outstanding accomplishment.

Congratulations to Senior Matt Bonshak, on earning his 100th career win as a wrestler at Whitehall.

The wrestling team finished its dual meet season with a record of 11-9. The team now looks forward to the individual post-season.

Our boys basketball team moved its record to 9-9 with a huge comeback win last night over Allen. The team needs to win 2 of its final 4 to qualify for the post-season.

The girls basketball team won its 4th game of the year last night and host Northampton for Senior Night on Friday.

The girls swim team is ramping up for the post-season and currently has a 7-4 while the boys are 2-10.

You can find our athletic schedules on either www.maxpreps.com or www.arbiterlive.com.

Middle School will dismiss at 1PM – High School at 1:30PM and Elementary (including PM kindergarten) at 2PM.
text: Be advised that due to the impacts that the forecasted snow will have on roadways (currently expected to begin when our buses would normally be out on PM runs) we are dismissing early today, January 25. Middle School will dismiss at 1PM – High School at 1:30PM and Elementary (including PM kindergarten) at 2PM.

post_text: Due to weather and road conditions, Whitehall High School will be operating on a 2-hour delay schedule today, January 16.
text: Due to weather and road conditions, Whitehall High School will be operating on a 2-hour delay schedule today, January 16.

post_text:
Good Afternoon,

As we know these are troubling times. I am contacting you today to update you regarding the measures the district has, and will continue to take to ensure the safety of our student s and staff.
• We continuously review and update our emergency plans and procedures.
• We provide training to our staff, conduct emergency drills and our district crisis teams work closely on crisis planning with emergency responders.
• As an additional proactive measure, we have increased the presence of the Whitehall Township Police on our campus throughout this entire week.
Please rest assured that we take all matters brought to us very seriously. Working collaboratively, with the Whitehall Township Police Department we investigate each matter and take the appropriate actions. Thank you for your continued support and have a wonderful winter break.

Sincerely,
John W. Corby
Superintendent of Schools
Whitehall-Coplay School District
